datasetStructure: One record per measurement per observation time per subject

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable VS.USUBJID

datasetVariables.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

datasetVariables.name: USUBJID

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable VS.VSSEQ

datasetVariables.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.

datasetVariables.name: VSSEQ

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable VS.VSGRPID

datasetVariables.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject. This is not the treatment group number.
datasetVariables.label: Group Identifier
datasetVariables.name: VSGRPID

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable VS.VSSPID

datasetVariables.description: Sponsor-defined reference identifier

datasetVariables.name: VSSPID

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C120536

modelClassVariable.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test or Examination

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable VS.VSTESTCD

datasetVariables.description: Short name of the measurement described in VSTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in VSTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). VSTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores.
datasetVariables.label: Vital Signs Test Short Name
datasetVariables.name: VSTESTCD

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C120537

modelClassVariable.title: Name of Measurement, Test or Examination

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable VS.VSTEST

datasetVariables.description: Long name for VSTESTCD. The value in VSTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters.
datasetVariables.label: Vital Signs Test Name
datasetVariables.name: VSTEST

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable VS.VSCAT

datasetVariables.description: Used to define a category of the vital signs measurement performed.
datasetVariables.label: Category for Vital Signs
datasetVariables.name: VSCAT

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable VS.VSSCAT

datasetVariables.description: A further categorization of the vital signs measurement performed.
datasetVariables.label: Subcategory for Vital Signs
datasetVariables.name: VSSCAT

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71148

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable VS.VSPOS

datasetVariables.description: Position of the subject during the measurement. If the subject is restrained, populate with the position (example SITTING or STANDING).
datasetVariables.label: Vital Signs Position of Subject
datasetVariables.name: VSPOS

modelClassVariable.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable VS.VSORRES

datasetVariables.description: Result of the vital signs measurement as originally received or collected.
datasetVariables.label: Result or Findings as Collected
datasetVariables.name: VSORRES

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable VS.VSORRESU

datasetVariables.description: The unit for the original result. The unit of the original result should be mapped to a synonymous unit on the Controlled Terminology (http://www.cdisc.org/terminology) list.
datasetVariables.label: Unit of the Original Result
datasetVariables.name: VSORRESU

modelClassVariable.title: Result or Finding in Standard Format

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable VS.VSSTRESC

datasetVariables.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from VSORRES in a standard format or standard units. VSSTRESC should store all results in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be submited in numeric format in VSSTRESN.
datasetVariables.label: Standardized Result in Character Format
datasetVariables.name: VSSTRESC

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable VS.VSSTRESN

datasetVariables.description: Used for numeric results or findings in standard format; contains the numeric form of VSSTRESC. VSSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
datasetVariables.label: Standardized Result in Numeric Format
datasetVariables.name: VSSTRESN

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable VS.VSSTRESU

datasetVariables.description: Standardized unit used for VSSTRESC and VSSTRESN.
datasetVariables.label: Unit of the Standardized Result
datasetVariables.name: VSSTRESU

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66789

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable VS.VSSTAT

datasetVariables.description: Used to indicate when a test is not done or result is missing. Should be null if a result exists in VSORRES.
datasetVariables.label: Completion Status
datasetVariables.name: VSSTAT

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable VS.VSREASND

datasetVariables.description: Describes why VSSTAT is NOT DONE, such as BROKEN EQUIPMENT.
datasetVariables.label: Reason Not Done
datasetVariables.name: VSREASND

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable VS.VSLOC

datasetVariables.description: Location relevant to the collection of the vital signs measurement. Example: RECTAL for Temperature.
datasetVariables.label: Location of Vital Signs Measurement
datasetVariables.name: VSLOC

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C90018

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable VS.VSCSTATE

datasetVariables.description: Consciousness state of the subject at the time of measurement. Examples: CONSCIOUS, SEMI-CONSCIOUS, UNCONSCIOUS.
datasetVariables.label: Consciousness State
datasetVariables.name: VSCSTATE

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable VS.VSBLFL

datasetVariables.description: A baseline indicator may be used to calculate differences or changes from baseline. Value should be Y or null. The baseline flag is sponsor defined.
datasetVariables.label: Baseline Flag
datasetVariables.name: VSBLFL

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable VS.VSDRVFL

datasetVariables.description: Used to indicate a derived record. The value should be Y or null.
datasetVariables.label: Derived Flag
datasetVariables.name: VSDRVFL

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable VS.VSEXCLFL

datasetVariables.description: Y if the result should be excluded from all calculations, otherwise null.
datasetVariables.label: Exclusion Flag
datasetVariables.name: VSEXCLFL

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable VS.VSREASEX

datasetVariables.description: The reason the result should be excluded from all calculations. Used only when VSEXCLFL is Y.
datasetVariables.label: Reason for Exclusion
datasetVariables.name: VSREASEX

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable VS.VSUSCHFL

datasetVariables.description: Indicates whether the timing of the performed test or observation was unscheduled. If a test or observation was performed based upon a schedule defined in the protocol, this flag should be null. Expected values are Y or null.
datasetVariables.label: Unscheduled Flag
datasetVariables.name: VSUSCHFL

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable VS.VISITDY

datasetVariables.description: Planned day of the vital signs measurement. Should be an integer.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Study Day of Collection
datasetVariables.name: VISITDY

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable VS.VSDTC

datasetVariables.description: Date/Time of the vital sign measurement, in ISO 8601 format. For indicating measurement over a period, DTC should be populated with the start date/time of collection.
datasetVariables.label: Date/Time of Measurement
datasetVariables.name: VSDTC

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable VS.VSENDTC

datasetVariables.description: Date/Time of the end of the vital sign measurement, in ISO 8601 format. Should be populated for continuous period only.
datasetVariables.label: End Date/Time of Measurement
datasetVariables.name: VSENDTC

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

priorVersion.title: Study Day of Vital Signs Measurement

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable VS.VSDY

self.title: Study Day of Vital Signs Measurement

datasetVariables.description: Study day of vital signs measurements, in integer days. For indicating measurement over a continuous period, VSDY can be used to indicate start day of that interval. The algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in the Demographics (DM) domain.
datasetVariables.label: Study Day of Vital Signs Measurement
datasetVariables.name: VSDY

modelClassVariable.title: Study Day of End of Observation

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

priorVersion.title: Study Day of End of Measurement

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable VS.VSENDY

self.title: Study Day of End of Measurement

datasetVariables.description: Study day of the end of the vital signs measurement, in integer days. Can be populated when VSDY represents the start day of a continuous evaluation interval. The algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in the Demographics (DM) domain.
datasetVariables.label: Study Day of End of Measurement
datasetVariables.name: VSENDY

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable VS.VSNOMDY

datasetVariables.description: Nominal study day used for grouping records for observations that may occur on different days into a single reported study day. Should be an integer.
datasetVariables.label: Nominal Study Day for Tabulations
datasetVariables.name: VSNOMDY

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable VS.VSNOMLBL

datasetVariables.description: A label for a given value of VSNOMDY as presented in the study report. Examples: Pre-Treatment, Week 4, Day 28.
datasetVariables.label: Label for Nominal Study Day
datasetVariables.name: VSNOMLBL

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable VS.VSTPT

datasetVariables.description: Text description of time when the vital signs measurement should be taken. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See VSTPTNUM and VSTPTREF. Examples: Predose, 1 Hour Postdose.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Time Point Name
datasetVariables.name: VSTPT

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable VS.VSTPTNUM

datasetVariables.description: Numerical version of VSTPT to aid in sorting.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Time Point Number
datasetVariables.name: VSTPTNUM

modelClassVariable.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable VS.VSELTM

self.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

datasetVariables.description: Planned elapsed time (in ISO 8601 format) relative to a planned fixed reference (VSTPTREF). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date time variable. Represented as a duration in ISO 8601 format. Examples: '-PT15M' to represent the period of 15 minutes prior to the reference point indicated by VSTPTREF or 'PT8H' to represent the period of 8 hours after the reference point indicated by VSTPTREF.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
datasetVariables.name: VSELTM

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable VS.VSTPTREF

datasetVariables.description: Name of the fixed reference point referred to by VSELTM, if used for VSTPTNUM, and VSTPT. It is recommended that VSTPTREF be as descriptive as possible so the reference time point can be inferred without looking at other variables. Examples: DAY 1 DOSE, DAY 1 MEAL.
datasetVariables.label: Time Point Reference
datasetVariables.name: VSTPTREF

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable VS.VSRFTDTC

datasetVariables.description: Date/Time of the reference time point, VSTPTREF.
datasetVariables.label: Date/Time of Time Point Reference
datasetVariables.name: VSRFTDTC

description: A findings domain that contains measurements including but not limited to blood pressure, temperature, respiration, body surface area, body mass index, height and weight. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, SDOMAIN, C49622, 2018-06-29)
label: Vital Signs
name: VS
